node.title: Another Gaddafi in Libya? Muammar's son pitches for power as presidential election draws near
node.alt: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi seated at a desk with a grey beard as he registers as presidential candidate, Nov 12, 2021.
node.description: Saif al-Islam al-Gaddafi has registered himself as a presidential candidate for the December elections. He hasn't appeared publiclyÂ in almost a decade.
node.content:
["The son of Libya's late dictator Muammar Gaddafi has appeared for nearly the first time in a decade to register as a presidential candidate for a December election that has been\u00a0planned to help end the years of chaos since his father was toppled.", "Saif al-Islam al-Gaddafi, 49, appeared in an electoral commission video on Sunday in a traditional brown robe and turban, and with a grey beard and glasses, signing documents at the election centre in the southern town of Sebha.", "Mr Gaddafi is one of the most prominent \u2014 and controversial \u2014 figures expected to run for president.", "However, while his name is one of the best known in Libya, and though he once played a major role in shaping policy before the 2011 NATO-backed uprising that destroyed his family's regime, he has barely been seen for a decade.", "", "
Saif al-Islam al-Gaddafi has been out of the public eye since he was seized by fighters after his father's death in 2011.(Reuters: Stringer/File photo)
", "Educated at the London School of Economics and a fluent English speaker, Saif al-Islam was once seen by many governments as the acceptable, Western-friendly face of Libya, and a possible heir apparent.", "But when a rebellion broke out in 2011 against his father Muammar Gaddafi's long rule, Saif al-Islam immediately chose family and clan loyalties over his many friendships in the West, telling Reuters:", "His formal entry into an election whose rules are still contested by Libya's squabbling factions may also cast new questions over a contest that features candidates viewed in some regions as unacceptable.", "Despite the public backing of most Libyan factions and foreign powers for elections on December 24, the vote remains in doubt as rival entities bicker over the rules and schedule.", "A major conference in Paris on Friday agreed to sanction any who disrupt or prevent the vote, but with less than six weeks to go, there is still no agreement on rules to govern who should be able to run.", "While Mr Gaddafi is likely to play on nostalgia for the era before the 2011 NATO-backed uprising that swept his father from power and ushered in a decade of chaos and violence, analysts say he may not prove to be a front-runner.", "", "
Saif al-Islam Gaddafi at\u00a0the 58th Berlin Film Festival in 2008.(AFP: Peer Grimm/DPA/File photo)
", "The Gaddafi era is still remembered by many Libyans as one of harsh autocracy, while Saif al-Islam and other former regime figures have been out of power for so long they may find it difficult to mobilise as much support as major rivals.", "Muammar al-Gaddafi was captured outside his hometown of Sirte by opposition fighters in October 2011 and summarily shot.\u00a0", "Saif al-Islam was seized days later by fighters from the mountainous Zintan region as he tried to flee Libya for Niger.", "
One son running for president, the other released from jail
", "Just over a decade later, Saif al-Islam is now something of a cipher for Libyans.\u00a0", "The Zintan fighters kept him for six years out of public sight and his views on the crisis are not known.", "He gave an interview to the New York Times earlier this year, but has not yet made any public appearance speaking directly to Libyans.", "Complicating his presidential ambitions, Mr Gaddafi was tried in absentia in 2015 by a Tripoli court at which he appeared via videolink from Zintan, and which sentenced him to death for war crimes including killing protesters during the 2011 revolt.", "He would likely face arrest or other dangers if he appeared publicly in the capital Tripoli.\u00a0", "He is also wanted by the International Criminal Court.", "Meanwhile, the younger son of the late Gaddafi was released from prison this\u00a0September, one decade on from the uprising that toppled his father's regime.", "Local media reported Saadi Gaddafi\u00a0was released after being acquitted of charges dating back to the uprising, when he headed a special forces brigade that cracked down on protesters and rebels.", "AP/ABC"]
